text: Tammisha (also spelled Tamisha or Tammishe; ) was a mediaeval city in Tabaristan. It is in the north of Iran, at the foot of the Alborz mountain. It was a very important place, and kings often lived there. The city was near Gurgan. It had a famous wall called the Tammisha Wall, which was built during the Sasanian era. It went from the Gorgan Bay and was 11 kilometres (6.8 miles) long. == References == Category:Ancient settlements Category:Cities in Mazandaran Province
title: Tammisha
